file_content.text: Farewell, Padawan.
Master Orgus?
You know, when I died--strange to say that--it wasn't my victories that gave me comfort.
It was all their faces--the people I'd helped. The people I'd served. Made the pain forgettable.
Suppose you last long enough to see the war end. How will you live? How will you find comfort, when your time finally comes?
With or without the war, I'll serve the Order as long as I can.
I'll be a Jedi until the end.
That means following the code and fighting if I have to. The Republic will always need Jedi.
Good friend of mine always dreamed of dying in a shop hold-up on Coruscant. There's always something to fight for.
When the war ends, I hope to be rid of my lightsaber forever. I want a quiet life--maybe on a farm, or cooking street food on Coruscant.
I'd like to retire someday.
Sometimes the Force leads us to simplicity. I hope you find what you want.
You make it sound like the end of the Empire would put an end to conflict.
War never ends.
There will always be pain, and there will always be struggle. I'll dance that dance forever.
Where there's struggle, there's also hope.
What we did today--I lied a bit. It wasn't just about helping Rishi or reminding you why you fight.
It was about healing an old scar you've almost forgotten. One that still aches inside you.
The Emperor.
You were under his control. His darkness soaked through to your spirit. When we freed you, you pushed the memories of his training down deep.
I can bring those memories back. You're strong enough to handle them; let the light cure them and make you whole.
I stood against the Emperor on Dromund Kaas. I don't fear him in my memories.
Yes. Let me be healed.
Nor should you. Fear only leads to hate. Today on Rishi, you felt love.
I am whole.
I'm not looking for healing. What happened... happened. I have to deal with it myself.
My scars are part of me.
Then all I ask is that you remember Rishi, and the people you served here.
I'll remember.
The Emperor immersed me in the dark side. Darth Revan was the only other Jedi to come back from that.
I want the darkness I forgot!
My memories of that time are power. That power is my right and my weapon. I claim it.
You know I think you're mistaken. No point in another lecture.
I'll give you what you asked for and hope you remember the right lesson today.
I am whole.
Then it's my time to go.
Thank you, Master Orgus--for all you've done for me. May it bring you peace.
I'll always remember you.
It already has.
There's still much I wish to understand--about the galaxy and the Jedi way.
Any last advice?
I don't have all the answers; maybe that's for the best.
You were my Master, Orgus Din, but I found my teachers elsewhere. It's past time you rested.
Our paths diverged long ago.
Maybe so.
You won't see me again, Padawan, but you won't have to. You won't be alone in the dark days to come.
The Force will be with you. Always.
Go and do good, Padawan.
I grew up here, you know. And I mean here--this house, not just Rishi.
Of course, I was young when the Jedi found me. Don't remember much more than the walls, a blanket and a few friendly faces....
Master Orgus.
...but it seemed as good a place as any to visit one last time.
Hello, Padawan. Got time for a final lesson from an old friend?
It's good to see you, Master. Any lesson you have to share, you know I'll listen.
Always, Master Orgus.
Whether you'll act on it is something else, hm? It's good to see you, too.
You must know that there's great danger on Rishi. Can you guide me against the Order of Revan?
Is this about the Revanites?
Can I? Maybe, but it's not really my place--besides, you outgrew me as a planner ages ago.
Then tell me why you're here.
You may have instructed me on Tython and saved me from the Emperor, but I don't remember us as friends. Does death make you nostalgic?
I hoped I was done with you.
More than you'd think, and we've never been as different as you liked to believe. Don't make me haunt you.
Why are you here?
Since you set out to defeat the Emperor, you've been fighting almost nonstop. You've been waist-deep in dirt and fear and blood.
Since the Emperor's fall, the war's only gotten uglier, and there are dark times coming--for the galaxy and for you.
You've sensed what's to come?
Just a little, and I'm worried you'll forget why you're fighting.
Defending the Republic, vanquishing the Sith... those are tools a Jedi uses in the service of life, of people. Not ends unto themselves.
Every day, I face pain. I inflict suffering--out of necessity, on those we call "the enemy"... it eats at you.
It can be hard sometimes.
That's the nature of war. I went through it, too. I want to help you reconnect.
When I fight, I'm fighting to preserve life, not destroy it. I serve the Force, and the Force is peace.
I haven't forgotten, Master.
I don't doubt you. But when's the last time you felt connected to that peace?
You think I kill out of passion, out of hunger. You think I've embraced the dark side.
You think I've fallen.
I'm not here to scold or tell you how to fight. I'm here to help you reconnect.
We're going to take a little time, help the people of Rishi. Folks eking out a living, good and bad, living in fear of guns and pirates.
You're going to make their lives better, as only you can. You're going to feel why you're a Jedi.
I can think of no better way to spend my time here. Where do we begin?
I'd like that.
Master Orgus, I have an urgent mission. I know what you're saying, but this isn't the time.
We don't have time for this.
Then when is? You can't go on like this, and I promise--we won't let the galaxy die because you were feeding a child.
I've surpassed you, Master Orgus, and I've surpassed the need for this kind of lesson.
You don't know what I am now.
Maybe so. Then humor me, and I'll make you a deal.
Whatever it is you're seeking to achieve, whatever you want to become--I'll help you when you're done here.
How?
I've still got some tricks you haven't seen.
Very well. Where do we begin?
There are a lot of people without homes on Rishi. Those people are catching Tanamen Fever; on Corellia, they'd cure it for free.
Here, no one much cares. No one but you--your Doc can treat a person in minutes, you've got a ship packed with food and medicine....
I understand.
Yes, you do. No Sith Lords, no ancient evils this time. Just doing a bit of good.
It's all right. Don't be afraid.
